pages.text:
Special Events
UPCOMING EVENTS
Meat & Greet – Chef’s Tasting Menu & Farm Tour
Special bundle discounts on meat packages!
Reserve your tickets here – $39 per person
PAST EVENTS
CANE BOIL – January 11, 2025
Thank you to everyone who braved the chilly weather and joined us for our 2025
Cane
Boil
& BBQ! We hope you had a great time enjoying the farm-fresh menu, live music, and getting a behind-the-scenes look at how we preserve our organic sugar
cane
crop. We also hope you had fun with the carrot and sweet potato u-pick experience!
Our delicious
cane
syrup
is available for purchase on our website and at the
farmers markets we attend
, so you can have a taste of the event at home.
For an event recap and recipe for the old fashioned lard biscuits we served,
click here
!
If you missed the event and would like to see how cane syrup is made on the farm, you can watch Farmer John in action on our
YouTube Channel.
SPRING FESTIVAL – March 16, 2024
This was our biggest event with over 500 people in attendance! We’re so grateful for the love and support from our community. We couldn’t have pulled this off without our team members and our amazing vendors & educators.
Schedule of Events:
Gate opens – 1:00 pm
Live Music – (V)OWLS – 1:30-3:15, AmBe 3:45-5:30
Fermentation workshop – 2:00 pm
Hayride Farm Tour – departing every hour 1:30-4:30 pm
Walking Farm Tour – departing every hour 2:00-5:00 pm
Food & beverages available for purchase will include:
Chicken hand pies – made with local pasture-raised, soy-free & organically raised chicken
Pasture-raised pork sausage from our farm
Sweet potato ice cream (vegan & GF)
Carrot cake (vegan & GF)
Veggie yellow curry & basmati rice bowls from Radha’s Kitchen (vegan)
Cold brew coffee & beans from Sweetwater Organic Coffee
Kombucha and fresh sugarcane juice from Berryland
Locally brewed beer from Cypress & Grove (by donation)
Fresh veggies & frozen pork from our farm
(We accept SNAP for groceries!)
Carrot U-Pick $5
Additional educational booths & vendors include:
Angela Minno, local author and farmer & meet Violet the goat
Bread of the Mighty – nutrition education & recipes
Crochets by Kata – handmade crochet items
CANE BOIL –  January 13th, 2024
Thank you to everyone who made the trip out to the farm today for our 2nd Annual Cane Boil & Farm Tour!
We had a great turnout, and guests learned about sugar cane, cover crops, pastured pigs and more on our tours.
We promise to make more food next time as we sold out WAY faster than expected. We will also do pre-sale meal tickets to have a better estimate of how much to prepare. We apologize to anyone who didn’t get a plate and hope you’ll give us another try at our next event. Thank you to our team for all of their work to make our farm and these events possible. We were all thrilled to see customers travel from Orlando, St. Augustine, and Sarasota, and visitors all the way from Washington State! Seeing people care about where their food comes from gives us some hope for the future, and we are honored to share the experience of being on the farm with you.
We didn’t even have to pull anyone’s car out of the mud with a tractor, so the day was a success!
ROSELLE FESTIVAL – SATURDAY, OCT 28
The second annual Roselle Festival was last weekend, and we’re already counting down to next year! Thank
you to our wonderful team, sponsors, vendors, volunteers, and the 400+ attendees who shared the day with us and picked over 300 pounds of fresh roselle from our fields! Other highlights included music from Gumbo Limbo Cajun Band and Brasileiro, farm tours, tractor rides, cooking demos, and a crop maze. Special thanks to Visit Gainesville for additional support! Ready for another day on the farm? Stay tuned for our winter Cane Boil dates!
Thank you, Strawberry and Sunflower U-Pickers!
Saturday, May 13 from 2-5pm
Saturday May 20 from 2-5pm
Join us at the farm for two special weekends. Our luscious, certified organic berries are $5 per pound. What makes them extra special is that they are grown without plastic mulch. We have worked on improving our system for over a decade using only hay mulch in our fields. The natural fertility of our soil and amendments help create one of the most flavorful berries you have experienced.
We’ll also have Tulsi iced tea and strawberry lemonade from our farm, along with a few other goodies available for purchase. We accept SNAP for eligible foods including frozen meats, fresh produce, packaged jam, coffee and tea.
If you registered for the event in April and didn’t get a chance to pick, we’d love to see you!
2023 SPRING FESTIVAL
Click here for our 2023 Spring Festival Highlights
We are so excited to welcome everyone to our farm on Saturday, April 15! Read below for our field report on strawberries and see the complete U-Pick lineup: calendula flowers, sunflowers, sweet onions, snow peas, and potatoes!
This event is free and open to the public, and we ask attendees to RSVP in order to receive fest day updates.
Click here for details and RSVP
.
Music Lineup sponsored by PPM Solar
1:30pm-3pm: Ruckus
3pm-4:30pm: Patchwork Duo
4:30pm-6pm: Ambient Benevolence
Culinary Lineup
Radha’s Kitchen: Vegan Fusion
Berry Land 352: Kombucha, Lemonade, Sparkling Apple Cider, Coffee, Chai Tea
Frog Song Organics Pastured-Pork Hot Dogs (Smoked or Salt Link)
Strawberry Short Cake
House made beverages available for sale and local beer by donation
Shop our farm stand for locally grown organic veggies and goods
Special Events and Education
1:30pm-2pm Farm Walking Tour with Amy Van Scoik. An educational stroll with Farmer Amy. Learn about our practices, explore the farm, and meet the animals during this interactive, guided tour. Bring your questions and walking shoes!
2:30pm-4pm
Mindful Nature Walk and Tea with Candace Jones.
A wellness experience led by certified nature therapy guide Candace. Participants will explore the farm using smell, sight, taste, and touch, followed by an informal tea ceremony. Sun protection, comfortable shoes, a journal and pen are recommended for this slow paced, sensory walk.
3:30pm-4:30pm Ask a Farmer! Q&A with Farmer John. Farmer John is passionate about sharing his knowledge to grow more organic farmers and gardeners. Join him for an hour of education, information sharing, and community during this interactive Q&A session.
All Day:
Organic Strawberry U-Pick ($5.00/lb.)
Sweet Onion U-Pick ($1.50/each)
Snow Pea U-Pick ($4.00/lb.)
Calendula U-Pick ($7/cup)
Sunflower U-Pick ($2/each)
Potato U-Pick ($1.50/lb.)
Full Farmer’s Market Stand
Kid’s Games and Activities -Corn Crib, Hay Bales, and prizes!
Merchandise and Shopping
Special Edition Spring Festival Shirt (pictured)
Hats & Totes – rep your favorite organic farm!
“
Farm Box
” in Individual ($40) & Family Size ($65). Can be purchased online & picked up at the Festival for convenience. Try a CSA box without the commitment. An easy way to try the best of what this season has to offer, along with being a good value. Includes seven to nine different items.
Strawberry Jam – Amy’s homemade jam, made with love and our delicious organic strawberries
Full selection of pasture raised pork
Cane syrup (samples available)
Helpful Tips & Info
This is a rain or shine event!
Parking is limited, please plan to carpool. RSVP to help us be prepared, and stay in touch in case of any event changes. Donations are welcome to help us cover the cost of the hosting the event, and to raise money for our future commercial kitchen and restroom structure.
This is a 100% outdoor event. Handwashing stations will be available and we hope everyone will use them!
Good items to bring: picnic blanket, camping chairs, hat, closed-toed shoes or mud boots, refillable water bottle or cup, reuseable shopping bag, umbrella or rain coat.
Cash, credit cards and SNAP accepted on site for farmers market items.
Please leave pets at home!
Strawberry Field Report
*Strawberries, unfortunately, will not be one of the abundant u-pick items. We are experiencing our most challenging strawberry crop in a decade. We attribute this mainly to the freeze that we had at the end of December, where we used water to save our citrus trees. The days of running sprinklers saved our trees, but it reduced the fertility in the soil. We traded off a strawberry crop for 2023 for the potential of citrus over the next decade. We also experienced pest pressure which caused cosmetic damage to the fruit that did grow. Our yields are the lowest we have ever seen, and those who have visited our U-Pick before will recall that previous years were much more abundant. We’ve been watching field conditions carefully, but the abundant yield has not appeared yet.
Knowing there were just a few sweet and delicious gems out in the field, we set up a reservation system for strawberries. We’ve now closed reservations to the field.
Normally this time of year we are swimming in strawberries, sometimes picking over two hundred pounds at a time. This year is a bit different but we will make the best of it. As farmers we are at the mercy of the weather and natural cycles, and in control of very little beyond how we interact with our soil and crops. We are still making a limited amount of jam with the berries that we are harvesting, so make sure to pick up a jar while it lasts. We’ll enjoy this sweet treat and look forward to a more abundant strawberry crop next year!

(Visitors/private tours welcome by appointment
only.)

Join Our Team
What Team Members Love About Working at Frog Song Organics:
Feeling pride about producing healthy food to feed our community
Staying active at work in the fresh air and sunshine
Taking home free farm food daily
Working with their hands and the earth
Staying connected to the seasons through eating local food
Sharing and socializing with the team at Farm Lunch on Tuesdays
Spending their $100/month credit on any items at our
Online Farm Store
Sharing tips with the whole team from our generous customers
Developing their skills in a supportive environment
Additional Benefits:
Paid sick leave to care for yourself or a family member/loved one
Monthly health care stipend – $20/month for your first year of employment
Paid time off for Full Time Staff
We are a hard-working bunch of optimists who love to grow and eat great food! We care about making a difference in the world and doing meaningful work with our bodies and minds. If this seems like an environment where you could thrive, please contact us! We offer a range of benefits to full and part time staff.
Housing may also be available after a successful 90 days of work on the farm.
Applicants may also be interested in our Farm Incubator Program. After one season of employment, staff will have the opportunity to apply to manage their own small plot of land and sell their crops through our existing channel. Reach out to us by email if you are interested in learning more.
1. To apply,
Click here to fill out an application
2. After filling out an application, send a brief cover letter message to
frogsongjobs@gmail.com .
Make sure to tell us about your favorite vegetable!
Click on the links below for details on job descriptions.
/wp:post-content

About Us
Co-founders John Bitter and Amy Van Scoik,
with their daughters, Coral and Jade
Frog Song Organics started in 2011. Our mission is to provide nutritious foods to our local community.  We believe sustainable farming can be possible with respect to our human, ecological and economic resources. We have been a certified organic farm since 2012 by Quality Certification Services.
Our farm’s location is in eastern Alachua County, only 30 minutes from the University of Florida in Gainesville. Come for a visit, and you’ll see the many varieties of produce, herbs, and flowers. Everything at our farm is grown directly in the soil to retain it’s rich flavor.
At the farm, you can also see our laying hens for eggs, pasture- raised pork and specialty items such as jams, kimchi, syrups and pickles.
